course_title: Topics in Mathematics: Introduction to Graph Theory
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 16 / Seats Avail: 7Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
Permission is required for enrollment. Please contact Taylr Tuggle (tatuggl@emory.edu) for permission into this course.
Prerequisites: Math 221 and (Math 250 or CS 224)
This course will be suitable for math majors interested in discrete mathematics who want more practice with both proofs and problem-solving. It should also interest CS majors who enjoyed the material in CS 224 and are interested in the theoretical side of computing.
course_description: Rotating topics in mathematics. May be repeated for credit when the topic varies. Pre and co requisites depend on the topic offered.
schedule_location: TTh 8:30am-9:45am in Math & Science Center - E406
